result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Viens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $443 costs, consecutive to sentence.
With Huber.  Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 4-4-2017; to Report by 5-30-2017.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott A. Viens in court with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 2 months, 20 days Rock Co Jail with Huber and diversion; 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $443 costs, consecutive to sentence; no sentence credit.
